page.title: 07WEYHILL POLICE.
page.content: James McNiven, living in Weyhill, is the local policeman. As he was on holiday we spoke to Ted Reynolds who shared the area with him during the miners' strike. In his view villages are becoming dormitories in which he can only conduct enquiries between 6pm. and 8pm.. Before and after that people tend to be out. Police work is concerned largely with traffic. The A303 at Weyhill is a bottleneck and there are between 12 & 15 serious accidents a year. The new road will provide 100% relief. The Thruxton Circuit necessitates the policing of the 12 events a year and local parachutists sometimes need rescuing. Burglary falls into two catagories: that organised by professional thieves attracted by antiques and opportunist thefts from parked cars at tourist attractions. WRVS give victim support.
